metadata.title: THE REGRESSORS OF FINANCIAL WELL-BEING AMONG LGU EMPLOYEES IN DAVAO DEL NORTE
metadata.description: Financial well-being is a vital aspect of an individual’s ability to manage obligations, prepare for financial shocks, and maintain long-term stability. Despite stable employment, many public sector workers in the Philippines still struggle with financial preparedness and responsible credit management, revealing a persistent gap in understanding the factors that shape their financial well-being. This study aimed to determine the regressors of financial well-being among LGU employees in Davao del Norte, focusing on financial literacy, accessibility, availability, affordability, and usage of financial services. A descriptive-correlational design was employed, using validated survey questionnaires distributed to 300 LGU employees. Statistical tools included mean, standard deviation, Pearson r, and multiple regression analysis. Significant relationships were observed between variables. The regression analysis indicated that accessibility, availability, affordability, and usage significantly predict financial well-being, while financial literacy was not a significant predictor. These findings imply that while financial literacy remains important, LGUs and policymakers should prioritize enhancing access and affordability of financial services. The study highlights the need for behavior-based financial literacy programs and inclusive financial systems that empower employees to achieve lasting financial security.

creators.name: DYNA MAE L. CLARO1*, JOSEPH ELMER G.  NOVAL, EdD, DM2

keywords: Accessibility, affordability, business management, financial literacy, financial well-being, usage.

journal.title: ISRG Journal of Economics, Business & Management (ISRGJEBM)

data.title: THE REGRESSORS OF FINANCIAL WELL-BEING AMONG LGU EMPLOYEES IN DAVAO DEL NORTE

metadata.title: Interacting Environmental factors affect targeted Milk thistle metabolomic profile and other growth components: A Review
metadata.description: Milk thistle (Silybum marianumL. Gaertn.) is a medicinally important herb of the family Asteraceae. Its achenes contain the active compound silymarin, which has gained significant attention in the pharmaceutical industryfor its hepatoprotective properties, including protection against hepatotoxic agents and stimulation of liver regeneration. However, biosynthesisand accumulation of active ingredients are strongly influenced by environmental variability.
references: Bilal Hafeez, M. (2025). Interacting Environmental factors affect targeted Milk thistle metabolomic profile and other growth components: A Review. Innovations in STEAM: Research & Education, 3(2). https://doi.org/10.63793/ISRE/0027

data.title: Interacting Environmental factors affect targeted Milk thistle metabolomic profile and other growth components: A Review

metadata.title: The Influence of Financing to Deposit Ratio, Mudharabah Financing, and Operating Efficiency Ratio on Non-Performing Financing
metadata.description:
ABSTRACT : 

The high Financing to Deposit Ratio (FDR), Mudharabah Financing, and Operating Efficiency Ratio (OER) values have the potential to cause non-performing (NPF), substandard, doubtful, and bad debts in Sharia Rural Banks (BPRS) in Indonesia in the 2019–2022 period. This research intends to analyze the influence of FDR, Mudharabah Financing, and OER on NPF. The type of research is quantitative research with analytical descriptive research methods. The data used is panel data from BPRS for 2019–2022. The research employed non-probability sampling approaches. The data analysis used in this research is quantitative data analysis. This research showed that partially, FDR and Mudharabah Financing do not affect Non-Performing Financing, while OER does. Simultaneously, FDR, Mudharabah Financing, and OER affect NPF. The coefficient of determination with an adjusted R-squared value of 0.073 indicates that the contribution of FDR, Mudharabah Financing, and OER to NPF is 7.3%. Meanwhile, the remaining 92.7% was affected by other variables outside the research.

creators.name: Yola Sartika
creators.affiliation: Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics and Business, Widyatama University, Indonesia

creators.name: Ingrid Larasati Agustina
creators.affiliation: Department of Accounting, Faculty of Economics and Business, Widyatama University, Indonesia

metadata.title: Die Einwohner der Stadt Murrhardt in Württemberg am 24. März 1735
metadata.description:
Die vorliegende Studie rekonstruiert die Bevölkerung der Stadt Murrhardt für den Stichtag 24. März 1735 anhand mehrerer sich ergänzender Quellen. Erfasst werden dazu die Haushaltsvorstände mit Namen, Beruf und dem von der Familie 1735 bewohnten Haus.
Diese Angaben werden um das Geburtsjahr des Ehemanns, dessen Herkunftsort, das Jahr der Eheschließung sowie das Alter der Ehepartner im Jahr 1735 ergänzt.
Hinzu treten Informationen zu Anzahl und jeweiligem Alter der Kinder sowie der weiteren Haushaltsangehörigen.
Grundlage der hier vorgelegten Einwohnerliste bilden drei Verzeichnisse: die Erbhuldigungsliste von 1735, das Ortsfamilienbuch Murrhardt und das Häuserbuch Murrhardt.
Die Studie enthält das Verzeichnis der Personen sowie einige statistische Auswertungen.

-------------------

This study reconstructs the population of the town of Murrhardt on March 24, 1735, based on several complementary sources. It records the heads of households with their names, occupations, and the houses occupied by their families in 1735.
This information is supplemented by the husband's year of birth, his place of origin, the year of marriage, and the age of the spouses in 1735.
In addition, there is information on the number and respective ages of the children and other household members.
The study contains a list of individuals and some statistical analyses.

data.title: Die Einwohner der Stadt Murrhardt in Württemberg am 24. März 1735

metadata.title: Best time of spraying irradiated carrageenan on the growth, yield and root nodulation of Mungbean [Vigna radiata (L.) Wilczek]
metadata.description:
Applying potential foliar fertilizer for mungbean at the best time can help farmers increase their yield and, subsequently, their income. Hence, the study was conducted to determine the growth, yield, and root nodulation performance of mungbean as influenced by the time of spraying irradiated carrageenan. The study was conducted at Candon City, Ilocos Sur, Philippines from January to May 2021 employing Randomized Complete Block Design with three blocks. The experimental treatments were as follows: T0: no application (control); T1: spraying at 6 a.m.; T2: spraying at 7 a.m.; T3: spraying at 8 a.m.; T4: spraying at 3 p.m.; T5: spraying at 4 p.m.; and T6: spraying at 7 p.m. The result of the study revealed significant differences in terms of survival rate (%), but no significant differences were noted in terms of number of days to emergence, flowering, and maturity, plant height at maturity (cm), number of pods per plant, length of the pod (cm), number of seeds per pod, weight of 100 seeds (g), plant growth and vigor, nodule abundance and color, nodule position, and effective nodulation assessment. Spraying of irradiated carrageenan at 8 a.m. produced the highest seed yield per hectare (2514.00kg) however, did not vary significantly with other spraying times. It was noted that spraying irradiated carrageenan can increase the yield of mungbean by 9.95% to 28.57%. The result suggests that irradiated carrageenan can be sprayed early in the morning (6 a.m. to 8 a.m.) and late in the afternoon to early evening (3 p.m. to 7 p.m.) by the farmers in the locality. Seed inoculation should also be done by the farmers to improve the root nodulation of mungbean plants.

published by the  Journal of Biodiversity and Environmental Sciences | JBES

metadata.title: Contemporary Trends in Research
metadata.description:
The landscape of research today is marked by unprecedented change, expanding possibilities, and evolving methodologies that continue to reshape how knowledge is produced, shared, and applied. As global challenges grow more complex and disciplines increasingly intersect, there is a pressing need to understand the directions in which scholarly inquiry is moving. Contemporary Trends in Research emerges from this need—an effort to capture the pulse of modern academia and highlight the transformative patterns redefining research across domains.

This volume brings together contributions from diverse fields, acknowledging that meaningful progress often arises when ideas flow freely across disciplinary borders. In an era where innovation depends not only on depth within a single field but also on breadth across many, the book offers a panoramic view of how researchers are responding to new demands, new tools, and new questions. From theoretical reconceptualizations to practice-oriented advancements, the chapters reflect the dynamic and collaborative nature of present-day inquiry.

Each author represented here contributes a unique perspective shaped by their own scholarly journey, yet all share a commitment to rigor, curiosity, and forward-looking thought. Their work illustrates how contemporary research is no longer confined to isolated silos but instead thrives through interaction—where traditional boundaries are questioned, methodologies are reimagined, and new frameworks for understanding are continually forged.

Our intention in compiling this book is not merely to observe patterns but to encourage critical engagement with them. By tracing emerging trends and exploring the forces driving intellectual transformation, we hope to inspire readers to reflect on their own roles within the research ecosystem. Whether through adopting novel approaches, pursuing interdisciplinary collaboration, or rethinking long-standing assumptions, researchers today have the opportunity to shape a future built on adaptability and innovation.

We envision this volume as a companion for scholars, students, educators, and practitioners who seek to navigate the evolving world of research with insight and purpose. May it offer both clarity and inspiration, and may it encourage the continued pursuit of knowledge that responds meaningfully to the complexities of our time.

metadata.title: Establishment of a Strategic Financing Mechanism for Sustained Construction and Maintenance of Zambia's Public Roads-A Case for Lusaka District
metadata.description: Investment in physical infrastructure, such as roads, bridges, airports, sea ports, water ports, railways etc., is a fundamental ingredient in the growth and economic development of a country. Compared to countries like Singapore, South Korea and China, countries in Sub-Saharan Africa have significantly underinvested in infrastructure over the years, resulting in stunted growth. Zambia, which has a large infrastructure funding gap, and a ballooning government debt, cannot rely solely on the government to meet its infrastructure funding needs. This study looked at establishment of a strategic financing mechanism for sustained construction and maintenance of Zambia’s public roads- a case of Lusaka district. The study adopted pragmatism philosophy, focusing on practical, real-world outcomes. It combined quantitative and qualitative methods to address establishment of a strategic financing mechanism for sustained construction and maintenance of Zambia’s public roads (Tashakkori & Teddlie, 2010). A mixed-methods approach was used, integrating both qualitative and quantitative techniques. Qualitative methods (interviews, focus groups) explored strategic mechanism of sustained financing for construction and maintenance of Zambia’s public roads, while quantitative surveys measured ways of sustaining the financing for construction and maintenance of the public roads This approach provided a comprehensive understanding of how to have a strategic mechanism to fund the construction and maintenance of public roads in Zambia (Creswell & Plano Clark, 2017). The study applied both deductive and inductive approaches. Data collected was analysed using the Dedose Software for the qualitative part and for the quantitative part a thematic analysis was used to come up with the results. Zambia has in place legal and institutional frameworks (Tembo, 2015) that are necessary for effective and efficient road asset management. This study established that a number of financing strategies or frame works for road construction and maintenance such as RoadSIP 1 and II and RoadSIP III (yet to be launched), performed fairly well albeit some challenges. It also established that most road projects under implementation are under the government’s balance sheet and that, the Road sector’s indebtedness to local Contractors and Consultants was increasing and the financing gap was widening. Zambia would need to spend an average of $1.6 billion a year over the decade 2022–30 to develop the infrastructure found in the rest of the developing world (Foster and Dominguez, 2010). To close this financial gap required raising more funds and looking for more effective ways to meet infrastructure targets. The study established that since traditional funding methods for road construction and maintenance in Zambia such as tax revenues and loans are becoming unsustainable, there is need to look for other alternatives. The study established the potential strategic sources of funding for sustained construction and maintenance of Zambia’s public roads include public private partnerships, equity financing, road tolls and establishment of a State Infrastructure Bank(s). The study also established a Strategic Road Financing Framework (SRFFW) that clearly illustrates the interconnection between institutional governance, revenue diversification, community engagement, and sustainability. To Address financing challenges, it was recommended that there is need to increase Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs) by inviting the private sector to participate in the construction, maintenance, and financing of roads.
keywords: Road Construction and Maintenance, Strategic Funding, Private Public Partnerships, Inadequate Financing, Strategic Road Financing Framework.

journal.title: Journal of Economics, Finance And Management Studies

data.title: Establishment of a Strategic Financing Mechanism for Sustained Construction and Maintenance of Zambia's Public Roads-A Case for Lusaka District

metadata.title: IMA++: ISIC Archive Multi-Annotator Dermoscopic Skin Lesion Segmentation Dataset
metadata.description:
Overview

The IMA++ dataset is the largest publicly available multi-annotator skin lesion segmentation (SLS) dataset, collected from the ISIC Archive to facilitate skin lesion image segmentation research. It contains 17,684 segmentation masks spanning 14,967 dermoscopic images, where 2,394 dermoscopic images have 2-5 segmentations per image from the ISIC Archive, annotated by 16 distinct annotators, with at least one annotation per image. The dataset captures a wide range of segmentation styles influenced by annotator expertise, tools used, and manual review processes, making it a valuable resource for developing and evaluating SLS models.

Files

  • segs.zip: A ZIP archive of the 22,472 segmentation masks. This includes 17,684 segmentation masks and the output of two consensus algorithms, bringing the number of segmentations up to 22, 472.
  • seg_metadata.csv: A CSV file containing the metadata for all the 22,472 segmentation masks.
  • img_metadata.csv: A CSV file containing the metadata for all the 14,967 skin lesion images.
  • seg_metadata_multiannotator_subset.csv: A CSV file containing the metadata for only the multi-annotator subset of IMA++ (i.e., 2,394 images with multiple segmentations per image).
  • iaa_metrics_pairwise.csv: A CSV file with the IAA metrics calculated for all mask pairs for all the images in the multi-annotator subset of IMA++.
  • iaa_metrics_image.csv: A CSV file with the pairwise IAA metrics averaged per image.
  • splits/{train,val,test}.csv: Standardized {training, validation, testing} partitions for the multi-annotator subset of IMA++.

Note that the 14,967 skin lesion images from the ISIC Archive corresponding to these segmentation masks are not included in this repository, and they can be obtained from the ISIC Archive. You can use the ISIC API to download images by their ISIC ID using the code in this repository.

Key Features

  • Inter-Annotator Variability: The dataset captures a wide range of segmentation styles, reflecting differences in annotator expertise, tools used (T1, T2, T3), and manual review processes (expert or novice).

  • Realistic multi-annotator scenario: Unlike most medical image segmentation datasets where every image is segmented by every annotator (i.e., a complete bipartite graph between annotators and images), IMA++ features an incomplete bipartite graph (i.e., every image is segmented by at least one annotator, but not all images are segmented by all annotators). This setup simulates real-world annotation scenarios where multiple annotators contribute to a subset of images.

  • Large-Scale Multi-Annotator Data: With 17,684 image-mask pairs from 16 annotators, IMA++ is the largest publicly available multi-annotator skin lesion segmentation dataset, enabling robust analysis of annotator preferences and segmentation styles.

  • Tool-Specific Segmentation Styles: The dataset allows for the exploration of tool-specific segmentation styles, as demonstrated in the segmentation style discovery paper, where differences among the three annotation tools (T1, T2, T3) were learned and captured by the segmentation model.

Citation

If you use the IMA++ dataset in your research, please cite the following papers:

Abhishek, K., Kawahara, J., Hamarneh, G. (2025). Segmentation Style Discovery: Application to Skin Lesion Images. In: Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention (MICCAI) ISIC Skin Image Analysis Workshop (MICCAI ISIC). MICCAI 2024. Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol 15274, pages 24–34. Springer, Cham. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-77610-6_3

Abhishek, K., Kawahara, J., Hamarneh, G. (2025). What Can We Learn from Inter-Annotator Variability in Skin Lesion Segmentation?. In: Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention (MICCAI) ISIC Skin Image Analysis Workshop (MICCAI ISIC). MICCAI 2025. Lecture Notes in Computer Science, vol 16149, pages 23–33. Springer, Cham. https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-032-05825-6_3

 

The BibTeX entries for these papers are:

@InProceedings{abhishek2024segmentation,
    author = {Abhishek, Kumar and Kawahara, Jeremy and Hamarneh, Ghassan},
    title = {Segmentation Style Discovery: Application to Skin Lesion Images},
    booktitle = {Proceedings of the International Conference on Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention (MICCAI) ISIC Skin Image Analysis Workshop},
    pages = {24--34}
    year = {2025},
    doi = {https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-031-77610-6_3},
    url = {https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-77610-6_3},
    publisher = {Springer Nature Switzerland},
    address = {Cham},
    isbn = {9783031776106}
}

@InProceedings{abhishek2024segmentation,
    author = {Abhishek, Kumar and Kawahara, Jeremy and Hamarneh, Ghassan},
    title = {What Can We Learn from Inter-Annotator Variability in Skin Lesion Segmentation?},
    booktitle = {Proceedings of the International Conference on Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention (MICCAI) ISIC Skin Image Analysis Workshop},
    pages = {23--33}
    year = {2025},
    doi = {https://doi.org/10.1007/978-3-032-05825-6_3},
    url = {https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-032-05825-6_3},
    publisher = {Springer Nature Switzerland},
    address = {Cham},
    isbn = {9783032058256}
}

License

The IMA++ dataset is made available under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International (CC BY-NC-ND 4.0) license. Additionally, since these annotations are collected from the ISIC Archive, by using these annotations, you acknowledge and confirm your compliance with their Terms of Use.

data.title: IMA++: ISIC Archive Multi-Annotator Dermoscopic Skin Lesion Segmentation Dataset

metadata.title: Structured PREreview of "The Return to the Einstein Spherical Universe Model"
metadata.description:
This Zenodo record is a permanently preserved version of a Structured PREreview. You can view the complete PREreview at https://prereview.org/reviews/17774954.

Does the introduction explain the objective of the research presented in the preprint? Yes
Are the methods well-suited for this research? Somewhat appropriate
Are the conclusions supported by the data? Somewhat supported
Are the data presentations, including visualizations, well-suited to represent the data? Somewhat appropriate and clear
How clearly do the authors discuss, explain, and interpret their findings and potential next steps for the research? Somewhat clearly I believe that the mathematization of the yin-yang principle can enrich physics. Because yin and yang are transforming into each other. The law of energy conservation is preserved. Here, the author should go deeper into the subject. I believe GR mathematics will not be of a big help. Relating Yin-Yang with QED (electromagnetic vacuum quantum) is a promising path.
Is the preprint likely to advance academic knowledge? Somewhat likely Yin-Yang philosophy reflects the deep truth of the universe. I believe that modern science could gain a great deal by studying this philosophy in depth and identifying possible applications in contemporary physics.
Would it benefit from language editing? No
Would you recommend this preprint to others? Yes, but it needs to be improved
Is it ready for attention from an editor, publisher or broader audience? Yes, after minor changes NASA measured in 2014 that the universe has Euclidean space. This means the universe is infinite in volume. The models of a finite universe, as of Einstein, are no longer plausible. The author is right that there is no time in the universe. He should go deeper into this subject, as it is of immense importance for the development of cosmology. The equations in this article have no physical meaning. But this is also the case with the Einstein field equations. His gravity tensor unit is not clear yet. We measure gravity with Newtons. Gravity is a force. The weak point of GR is that the geometrization of gravity cannot explain the physical origin of the gravitational force. The author should go deeper into this subject, where space is yin and matter is yang. Maybe this dynamics can give a new model of gravity, which is the leading force of the universe.

Competing interests

The author declares that they have no competing interests.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI)

The author declares that they did not use generative AI to come up with new ideas for their review.

data.title: Structured PREreview of "The Return to the Einstein Spherical Universe Model"

metadata.title: Manim – Mathematical Animation Framework
metadata.description:
What's Changed

Breaking Changes and Deprecations

New Features

  • Introduce seed in random_color method to produce colors deterministically by @ishu9bansal in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4265
  • Add support for arithmetic operators //, %, *, ** and / on ValueTracker by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4351
  • Add TangentialArc mobject by @Brainsucker92 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4469

Fixed Bugs and Enhancements

  • Fix environment formating for Tex() mobject by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4159
  • Improved consistency of rate_function implementations by @BenKirkels in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4144
  • Make new Code mobject compatible with OpenGL renderer by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4164
  • Fix HSL color ordering in ManimColor by @thehugwizard in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4202
  • Fix return type of Polygram.get_vertex_groups() and rename variables in .round_corners() by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4063
  • Improve Mobject.align_data docstring by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4152
  • Fix :meth:VMobject.pointwise_become_partial failing when vmobject is self by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4193
  • Fix add_points_as_corners not connecting single point to existing path by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4219
  • Complete typing for logger_utils.py by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4134
  • Fix(graph): Allow any Line subclass as edge_type in Graph/DiGraph by @Akshat-Mishra-py in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4251
  • Replace exceptions, remove unused parameters, and fix type hints in Animation, ShowPartial, Create, ShowPassingFlash, and DrawBorderThenFill by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4214
  • Fix: Axes submobject colors are not being set properly by @ishu9bansal in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4291
  • Refactor Rotating and add docstrings to Mobject.rotate() and Rotating by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4147
  • Fix default config of manim init project to use correct pixel_height and pixel_width by @StevenH34 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4213
  • Handle opacity and transparent images by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4313
  • Gracefully fall back when version metadata is missing by @mohiuddin-khan-shiam in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4324
  • Fix for issue 4255 - Do not clear points when the number of curves is zero by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4320
  • Use utf-8 encoding to read generated .tex files. by @OliverStrait in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4334
  • Add zero to vmobject points to remove negative zeros in get_mobject_key by @elshorbagyx in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4332
  • Ensure stroke_width attribute of SVGMobject is not set to None by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4319
  • Fix Prism incorrectly rendering with dimensions=[2, 2, 2] in OpenGL by @ra1u in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4003
  • Fix BraceLabel.change_label() and document BraceText by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4347
  • Include Text.gradient in hash to properly regenerate Text when its gradient changes by @AbhilashaTandon in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4099
  • Fixed surface animations in OpenGL by @nubDotDev in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4286
  • Add type hints and support for arithmetic operators + and - on ValueTracker by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4129
  • Fix duplicate references in Scene.mobjects after ReplacementTransform with existing target mobject by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4242
  • Optimize always_redraw() by reducing Mobject copying in Mobject.become() by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4357
  • Enhance manim cfg show output and add info-level logging for config files read by @xnov18 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4375
  • Let Cube use Bevel type line joints by @nubDotDev in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4361
  • Properly define init_points methods for use in OpenGL instead of defining init_points = generate_points by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4360
  • Allow passing a tuple to buff in SurroundingRectangle to specify buffer in x and y direction independently by @nubDotDev in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4390
  • Rewrite color_gradient to always return a list of ManimColors by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4380
  • Ensure leading whitespace does not change line height for lines in CodeMobject by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4392
  • Simplify the function remove_invisible_chars in text_mobject.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4394
  • Fix some config options specified via --config_file not being respected properly by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4401
  • Fix: Correct resolution tuple order to (height, width) by @Nikhil172913832 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4440
  • Ensure that start and end points are stored as float values in Line3D by @SirJamesClarkMaxwell in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4080
  • OpenGL: Fix iterated nesting in DecimalNumber.set_value by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4373
  • Update default resolution in CLI to match Manim's 1920x1080 default settings by @SASHAKT1290 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4452
  • Better parsing of color styles in CodeMobject by @SirJamesClarkMaxwell in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4454
  • Allow selection of all scenes to render using '*' by @NightyStudios in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4470
  • Prevent mutation of about_point in apply_points_function_about_point by @Morkunas in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4478
  • Fix behavior of Mobject.suspend_updating: when only suspending parent mobject, let children continue updating by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4402
  • Allow passing a buff to LabeledDot by @nubDotDev in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4403
  • Pass ndarrays to mapbox_earcut.triangulate_float32() to fix TypeError in mapbox_earcut==2.0.0 by @GuiCT in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4479
  • Fix duplicated arrow tips in DashedVMobject (issue #3220) by @jakekinchen in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4484

Documentation

  • Add docstring to :meth:.Mobject.get_family by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4127
  • Fix link formatting and clarify the distinction between Manim versions in index.rst by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4131
  • Add instructions for installing system utilities cairo and pkg-config via Homebrew on MacOS by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4146
  • Add missing line break in Code of Conduct's conflict of interest policy by @Hasan-Mesbaul-Ali-Taher in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4185
  • Fix links to Pango website by @ragibson in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4217
  • Replace poetry with uv in the README by @xinoehp512 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4226
  • Improve docstring for interpolate method in Mobject class by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4149
  • Add docstrings to Line and remove None handling for path_arc parameter by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4223
  • Add docstring to :meth:Mobject.family_members_with_points by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4128
  • Update incorrect docstring for :attr:ManimConfig.gui_location property by @SAYAN02-DEV in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4254
  • Fix formatting of color space documentation by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4274
  • Enhance and Paraphrase Description of ManimCE in README.md by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4141
  • docs: add explanation about the rate_func in the custom animation by @pedropxoto in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4278
  • Fixed artifact in docstring of Animation by @barollet in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4283
  • Rename update function dot_position to update_label in .add_updater example by @irvanalhaq9 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4196
  • Fix Microsoft typo in TexFontTemplateLibrary scene in example_scenes/advanced_tex_fonts.py by @alterdim in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4305
  • Improved readability, grammar, as well as added docstrings for consistency by @NASAnerd05 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4267
  • Add docstrings for ChangingDecimal and ChangeDecimalToValue by @haveheartt in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4346
  • Fix Sphinx exceptions when trying to build documentation via latex / as pdf by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4370
  • Added license information to documentation landing page by @Nikil-D-Gr8 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/3986
  • Set the default Python version to 3.13 in the uv installation guide by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4480

Maintenance and Testing

  • Change project management tool from poetry to uv by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4138
  • Re-add ffmpeg as dependency within Docker image by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4150
  • Add tests for Matrix, DecimalMatrix, IntegerMatrix by @pdrzan in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4279
  • Add tests for polylabel utility by @giolucasd in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4269
  • Add support for pycodestyle W rule in Ruff by @KaiqueDultra in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4276
  • Fix files with few MyPy typing errors by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4263
  • Explicitly mention all files that mypy should ignore in the mypy.ini configuration file by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4306
  • Remove dead code from scene.py and vector_space_scene.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4310
  • Add type annotations to scene.py and vector_space_scene.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4260
  • Replace setup-texlive-action in CI workflow by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4326
  • Adding type annotations to polyhedra.py and matrix.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4322
  • Handling typing errors in text/numbers.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4317
  • Move configure_pygui into a Scene method and remove manim.gui by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4314
  • Add typing annotations to svg_mobject.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4318
  • Add type annotations to mobject/svg/brace.py and default to label_constructor=Text in BraceText by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4309
  • Add classes MethodWithArgs, SceneInteractContinue and SceneInteractRerun inside new module manim.data_structures by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4315
  • Fix typo in import of OpenGLCamera in utils/hashing.py by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4352
  • Add type annotations to manim/renderer/shader.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4350
  • Add type annotations to tex_mobject.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4355
  • Add type annotations to three_d_camera.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4356
  • Revert change of default value for tex_environment by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4358
  • Add type hints to scene_file_writer.py, section.py, and zoomed_scene.py by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4133
  • Add type annotations for most of camera and mobject.graphing by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4125
  • Add VectorNDLike type aliases by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4068
  • Add type annotations to dot_cloud.py, vectorized_mobject_rendering.py and opengl_three_dimensions.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4359
  • Add type annotations to indication.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4367
  • Add type annotations to composition.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4366
  • Add type annotations to growing.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4368
  • Add type annotations to movement.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4371
  • Exclude check for cyclic imports by CodeQL by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4384
  • Refactor imports from collections.abc, typing and typing_extensions for Python 3.9 by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4353
  • Add type annotations to opengl_renderer_window.py by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4363
  • Rename SceneFileWriter.save_final_image() to save_image() by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4378
  • Add type annotations to text_mobject.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4381
  • Rename types like RGBA_Array_Float to FloatRGBA and add types like FloatRGBA_Array by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4386
  • Add type annotations to opengl_geometry.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4396
  • Add type annotations to moving_camera.py by @henrikmidtiby in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4397
  • Add type annotations to opengl_mobject.py by @RBerga06 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4398
  • Fix failing pre-commit tests by @cclauss in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4434
  • Add type annotations to cairo_renderer.py by @fmuenkel in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4393
  • Fix type errors and add typings for Mobject.apply_function(), its derivatives, and other utility functions by @godalming123 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4228
  • Bump macOS image from deprecated macos-13 to macos-15-intel by @chopan050 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4481
  • Prepare new release v0.19.1 and bump minimum required Python version to 3.10 by @behackl in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4490

Dependency Version Changes

  • Bump typing extensions minimum version by @JasonGrace2282 in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4121
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4122
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4140
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4148
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4181
  • Bump astral-sh/setup-uv from 5 to 6 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4234
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4204
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4391
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4405
  • Bump actions/setup-python from 5 to 6 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4433
  • Bump actions/checkout from 4 to 5 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4418
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4409
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4460
  • [pre-commit.ci] pre-commit autoupdate by @pre-commit-ci[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4467
  • Bump github/codeql-action from 3 to 4 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4466
  • Bump astral-sh/setup-uv from 6 to 7 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4465
  • Bump actions/upload-artifact from 4 to 5 by @dependabot[bot] in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4464

New Contributors

  • @BenKirkels made their first contribution in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4144
  • @Hasan-Mesbaul-Ali-Taher made their first contribution in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4185

  • @elshorbagyx made their first contribution in https://github.com/ManimCommunity/manim/pull/4332

metadata.notes: We acknowledge the importance of good software to support research, and we note that research becomes more valuable when it is communicated effectively. To demonstrate the value of Manim, we ask that you cite Manim in your work.
